text: Robert Boutigny (24 July 1927 â€“ 22 July 2022) was a French sprint canoeist. He was in two Summer Olympics, he won a bronze medal in the C-1 1000 m event at London in 1948. Boutigny also won two medals at the 1950 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships. He was born in Villeneuve-le-Roi, France. Boutigny died on 22 July 2022, two days before his 95th birthday. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:Sportspeople from Paris Category:Canoeists
title: Robert Boutigny
